Class Game

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Network.ObservableModel
it.polimi.ingsw.is25am22new.Model.Games.Game
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
Level2Game, TutorialGame
public abstract class Game extends ObservableModel implements Serializable
The Game class represents the core structure and functionalities of the game. It manages all necessary game components, player actions, and game progression. This class provides functionalities for setting up, playing, and ending the game.
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game(List<String> playerList, List<ObserverModel> observers)
      Constructs a new Game instance and initializes the game components, including player shipboards, a bank, dice, hourglass, and the game setup phase. Observers, if provided, are registered to the model.
      Parameters:
      playerList - a list of nicknames of players participating in the game
      observers - a list of observers to be registered to the game model, or null if no observers are to be added

    • Game

      public Game(List<String> playerList, Bank bank, List<ComponentTile> coveredComponentTiles, List<ComponentTile> uncoveredComponentTiles, Map<String,Shipboard> shipboards, Flightboard flightboard, List<AdventureCard> cardArchive, Hourglass hourglass)
      Constructs a new Game instance with the provided parameters. This constructor is primarily intended for testing purposes, allowing initialization of the game with specific components and data.
      Parameters:
      playerList - a list of nicknames of players participating in the game
      bank - the bank instance managing resources and transactions during the game
      coveredComponentTiles - a list of component tiles that are currently covered and not available for selection
      uncoveredComponentTiles - a list of component tiles that are uncovered and available for selection
      shipboards - a map that associates each player's nickname with their respective shipboard
      flightboard - the flightboard instance used to manage in-game space travel mechanics
      cardArchive - a list of adventure cards that have been used and archived during the game
      hourglass - the hourglass instance managing the timing mechanics and phases of the game

  • Method Details

    • initGame

      public void initGame()
      Initializes the game by setting up necessary components such as the game board and adventure card archive, and transitions the game to the next phase if applicable. This method uses an ObjectMapper to deserialize and load data into the game components, ensuring that the game's initial state is properly configured. It relies on helper methods from the GameInitializer class to perform these operations. Once the components are initialized, the game automatically attempts to switch to the next phase of gameplay using the gamePhase.trySwitchToNextPhase() method, which manages the progression of the game phases.

    • placeAstronauts

      public void placeAstronauts(String nickname, int i, int j)
      Places astronauts on a specified tile of the shipboard belonging to the specified player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player whose shipboard will be updated
      i - the row index of the target tile on the shipboard
      j - the column index of the target tile on the shipboard
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the tile is not a cabin, is already occupied, or does not exist
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called in the wrong game phase

    • placeBrownAlien

      public void placeBrownAlien(String nickname, int i, int j)
      Places a brown alien on a specified tile of the shipboard belonging to the specified player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player whose shipboard will be updated
      i - the row index of the target tile on the shipboard
      j - the column index of the target tile on the shipboard
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the tile is not a cabin, is already occupied, does not exist, or if a brown alien cannot be placed at the given coordinates
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called in the wrong game phase

    • placePurpleAlien

      public void placePurpleAlien(String nickname, int i, int j)
      Places a purple alien on a specified tile of the shipboard belonging to the specified player.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player whose shipboard will be updated
      i - the row index of the target tile on the shipboard
      j - the column index of the target tile on the shipboard
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the tile is not a cabin, is already occupied, does not exist, or if a purple alien cannot be placed at the given coordinates
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called in the wrong game phase

    • pickCoveredTile

      public void pickCoveredTile(String nickname)
      Allows the specified player to pick a covered component tile and sets it as their current tile in hand. Updates the list of remaining covered component tiles and notifies observers about the changes.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player who is picking the covered tile
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there are no covered component tiles available to pick or if the method is called in the wrong game phase

    • pickUncoveredTile

      public void pickUncoveredTile(String nickname, String tilePngName)
      Allows a player to pick an uncovered component tile identified by its PNG name and sets it as their current tile in hand. Updates the list of uncovered component tiles and notifies observers of the changes.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player who is picking the uncovered tile
      tilePngName - the PNG name of the component tile to be picked
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if there are no uncovered component tiles available or if the specified tile does not exist or if the method is called in the wrong game phase

    • rotateClockwise

      public void rotateClockwise(String nickname)
      Rotates the component tile currently in hand of the specified player clockwise.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player whose component tile in hand will be rotated

    • rotateCounterClockwise

      public void rotateCounterClockwise(String nickname)
      Rotates the component tile currently in hand of the specified player counterclockwise.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player whose component tile in hand will be rotated

    • weldComponentTile

      public void weldComponentTile(String nickname, int i, int j)
      Welds the component tile currently in hand of the specified player to the specified coordinates on their shipboard. If a component tile is already present in the targeted coordinates, an exception is thrown.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player whose shipboard will be updated
      i - the row index of the target tile on the shipboard
      j - the column index of the target tile on the shipboard
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if a component tile is already present in the specified location or if the method is called in the wrong game phase

    • standbyComponentTile

      public void standbyComponentTile(String nickname)
      Places the component tile currently being held by the specified player into standby mode, updates the shipboard state, and notifies all relevant components of the changes.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the identifier for the player whose component tile is being placed in standby mode
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called in the wrong phase

    • pickStandByComponentTile

      public void pickStandByComponentTile(String nickname, int index)
      Picks a standby component tile for a given shipboard based on the provided nickname and index. The selected tile is set as the tile in hand for the specified shipboard and relevant updates are triggered.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the identifier for the shipboard from which the standby component tile is being picked
      index - the index of the standby component tile to pick
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called in the wrong phase

    • discardComponentTile

      public void discardComponentTile(String nickname)
      Discards the current tile in hand of the specified component and updates the relevant state.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the identifier of the component whose tile is being discarded
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called in the wrong phase

    • finishBuilding

      public void finishBuilding(String nickname, int pos)
      Marks the completion of a building phase for a player's shipboard and updates the game state.
      Parameters:
      nickname - The nickname of the player finishing their building phase.
      pos - The position identifier where the rocket is placed (valid values are 0, 1, 2, 3).
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called in the wrong phase

    • pickCard

      public void pickCard()
      Selects a card from the deck and sets it as the current card. Updates the deck and the current card to reflect the changes.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called in the wrong phase

    • playerAbandons

      public void playerAbandons(String nickname)
      Handles the scenario where a player abandons their participation. This includes updating the player's shipboard status, removing their rockets and positions from the flightboard, and notifying all relevant components about the updates.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the unique identifier of the player who is abandoning

    • destroyTile

      public void destroyTile(String nickname, int i, int j)
      Destroys a tile on the shipboard for the specified player and updates the game state accordingly.
      Parameters:
      nickname - the nickname of the player whose shipboard tile is to be destroyed
      i - the row index of the tile to be destroyed
      j - the column index of the tile to be destroyed
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called in the wrong phase

    • getCardPiles

      public List<CardPile> getCardPiles()
      Retrieves the list of card piles.
      Returns:
      a list containing all the card piles. If there are no card piles, an empty list is returned.

    • endGame

      public abstract Map<String,Integer> endGame()
      Ends the current game session and calculates the final scores for all players.
      Returns:
      a map containing the players' names as keys and their corresponding final scores as values

      Returns:
      the current AdventureCard object.

    • setCurrPlayerToNext

      public void setCurrPlayerToNext()
      Updates the current player to the next player in the ordered list of rockets. The method retrieves the next rocket in the list relative to the current player and sets it as the new current player. If the current player is the last one in the list, an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be caught and an error message will be displayed. Exceptions: - IndexOutOfBoundsException: Thrown if the current player's position in the list is the last element and there is no next player to assign. The exception is caught and an error message is printed to the console.

    • setCurrPlayerToLeader

      public void setCurrPlayerToLeader()
      Sets the current player to the leader of the game. If the ordered rockets on the flightboard are empty, the method will attempt to transition the game to the next phase. Otherwise, it assigns the first player in the list of ordered rockets as the current player.

    • getLastPlayer

      public String getLastPlayer()
      Retrieves the name or identifier of the last player from the flightboard's ordered list of rockets.
      Returns:
      the name or identifier of the last player in the list

    • getBank

      public Bank getBank()
      Retrieves the current instance of the bank.
      Returns:
      the bank instance associated with this context.

    • getDices

      public Dices getDices()
      Retrieves the Dices instance associated with this object.
      Returns:
      the Dices instance

    • isHourglassActive

      public boolean isHourglassActive()
      Checks whether the hourglass is active based on its remaining time. The hourglass is considered active if the remaining seconds are less than 60.
      Returns:
      true if the hourglass has less than 60 seconds remaining, false otherwise.

    • isPlayerStillAbleToPlay

      public boolean isPlayerStillAbleToPlay(String player)
      Determines whether a player is still able to play the game based on their current status and state on the flightboard.
      Parameters:
      player - the identifier for the player whose playability is to be checked.
      Returns:
      true if the player is still able to play, false otherwise.

    • manageInvalidPlayers

      public void manageInvalidPlayers()
      Manages players who are no longer able to continue playing. This method iterates through the list of players in the flightboard and checks if they are still eligible to play. Players who are deemed invalid are removed from the flightboard's ordered rockets list and their positions are removed from the associated positions data. Additionally, it triggers any necessary actions when a player abandons the game. The eligibility of a player is determined by the method isPlayerStillAbleToPlay. Once a player is identified as invalid, their data is cleaned up to maintain consistency and to ensure that only active players remain in the game.

    • activateCard

      public void activateCard(InputCommand inputCommand)
      Activates the effect of the current card, updates its state, and performs necessary updates to the game phase.
      Parameters:
      inputCommand - the command that carries information or parameters required to activate the card's effect
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the method is called in the wrong phase

    • setGamePhase

      public void setGamePhase(GamePhase gamePhase)
      Sets the current phase of the game.
      Parameters:
      gamePhase - the game phase to set, defining the current stage of the game

    • getGamePhase

      public GamePhase getGamePhase()
      Retrieves the current phase of the game.
      Returns:
      the current GamePhase object representing the state of the game.

    • getHourglassSpot

      public int getHourglassSpot()
      Retrieves the value representing the hourglass spot.
      Returns:
      an integer indicating the hourglass spot
